Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
Fire hydrant

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system
Good sun visors and windscreen
An efficient carburettor and heater

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer
No – not at all

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may not pass
Only trucks may park here
You may stop for no more than 5 minutes
No vehicles may stop here

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?

Answers.Answer: 50km/h
40km/h
30km/h
20km/h

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive slower than 50km/h
Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
Do not drive faster than 50km/h
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:

Answers.Answer: 8pm to 6am
10pm to 5am
10pm to 6am
11am and 7am

Question: What must you do when you see blue and red flashing lights behind you?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Slow down and drive on carefully
Slow down and stop
Drive on as usual

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow
To park for 5 minutes only
As a driving lane
To unload goods or passengers

Question: If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Before making a lane change to your left, you must signal for at least 3 seconds. What else must you do?

Answers.Answer: Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights) to warn other road users
Use your vehicle hazard lights to warn other road users
Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout
sway from side to side
slow down

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: The passengers themselves
The parents of the passengers
You as the driver of the vehicle
Other passengers in your vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a give way sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
You must not go unless it is safe
Give way to all other vehicles, except those that have stopped at a stop sign
All of the above

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: A police officer
An AA mechanic
A tow truck driver
An ambulance driver

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road
